actor_awards.notes: Best known for his Oscar-winning role as Willie Stark in 'All the King's Men' and as Chief Dan Mathews in the TV series 'Highway Patrol'. He was often cast as tough guys, gangsters, or police officers due to his gravelly voice and imposing presence.

filmography.title: All the King's Men
filmography.role_description: A rural lawyer who rises to become a powerful and corrupt governor, loosely based on Huey Long.
filmography.plot: The rise and fall of a corrupt politician, who starts as a man of the people but loses his soul to power.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actor; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor

filmography.title: Born Yesterday
filmography.role_description: A corrupt, bullying junk tycoon who hires a tutor to refine his uneducated girlfriend.
filmography.plot: A millionaire junk dealer hires a journalist to educate his girlfriend, only to have her question his corrupt business practices.

filmography.title: Il Bidone
filmography.role_description: An aging small-time con man in Italy who begins to question his life of swindling poor peasants.
filmography.plot: Three swindlers disguise themselves to cheat the poor, but the leader faces a crisis of conscience.

filmography.title: Scandal Sheet
filmography.role_description: A ruthless newspaper editor who accidentally kills his estranged wife and tries to cover it up while his own reporters investigate.
filmography.plot: An editor turns a failing paper into a scandal sheet, but his past catches up with him in the form of a murder investigation.

filmography.title: Human Desire
filmography.role_description: A jealous and abusive husband who murders his boss and forces his wife to help cover it up.
filmography.plot: A railroad engineer gets caught in a love triangle with a co-worker's wife, who wants him to kill her husband.

filmography.title: The Mob
filmography.role_description: A police detective who goes undercover as a dockworker to infiltrate a waterfront mob.
filmography.plot: A detective goes undercover to find a cop killer and exposes a mob ring controlling the docks.

filmography.title: Down Three Dark Streets
filmography.role_description: An FBI agent who takes on three different cases simultaneously to find the killer of his partner.
filmography.plot: After his partner is killed, an FBI agent works three seemingly unrelated cases to flush out the murderer.

filmography.title: New York Confidential
filmography.role_description: A powerful New York crime boss who struggles to balance his syndicate business with his family life.
filmography.plot: A crime boss tries to run his syndicate like a corporation, but internal betrayal and family issues threaten his empire.

filmography.title: Big House, U.S.A.
filmography.role_description: A brutal and calculating convict who orchestrates a prison break and kidnapping scheme.
filmography.plot: A group of convicts executes a daring escape to recover hidden ransom money from a kidnapping.

filmography.title: Not as a Stranger
filmography.role_description: A Jewish pathologist and mentor who challenges the main character's arrogance and lack of compassion.
filmography.plot: An ambitious medical student marries a nurse for her money to pay his tuition but eventually learns humility.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: The Fastest Gun Alive
filmography.role_description: A notorious gunslinger who terrorizes a town and challenges a peaceful storekeeper to a duel.
filmography.plot: A mild-mannered shopkeeper with a secret past as a fast draw is forced to defend his town against a bank robber.

filmography.title: Between Heaven and Hell
filmography.role_description: An incompetent and paranoid company commander in the Pacific theater of WWII who endangers his men.
filmography.plot: A wealthy Southern landowner serving in the Pacific during WWII learns humility and brotherhood in a penal unit.

filmography.title: The Decks Ran Red
filmography.role_description: A mutinous crew member who plots to kill the captain and crew to claim salvage rights on the ship.
filmography.plot: A captain faces a mutiny orchestrated by a crewman plotting to kill everyone on board for the salvage money.

filmography.title: Convicts 4
filmography.role_description: The tough but fair prison warden who oversees the rehabilitation of a death row inmate.
filmography.plot: Based on a true story, a prisoner on death row finds redemption through art and eventual release.

filmography.title: Seven Sinners
filmography.role_description: A brawling, loyal sidekick to Marlene Dietrich's character, always ready for a fight.
filmography.plot: A cabaret singer with a reputation for causing trouble falls for a handsome naval officer on a South Seas island.

filmography.title: The Black Cat
filmography.role_description: An opportunist real estate agent who gets caught up in a murder mystery at an old mansion.
filmography.plot: Greedy relatives gather at an estate for the reading of a will, but murder and mystery ensue in this horror-comedy.

filmography.title: Butch Minds the Baby
filmography.role_description: A sentimental safecracker who has to take a baby along on a heist.
filmography.plot: A convicted safecracker gets paroled but is forced to take a baby with him on his next job.

filmography.title: Larceny, Inc.
filmography.role_description: A dim-witted but lovable ex-convict who helps his friends buy a luggage store to rob the bank next door.
filmography.plot: Three ex-cons buy a luggage shop next to a bank, planning to tunnel into the vault, but legitimate business gets in the way.

filmography.title: Night People
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, blustering American industrialist who demands the return of his kidnapped son from East Berlin.
filmography.plot: A U.S. soldier is kidnapped in Berlin, and his father tries to use his influence to get him back, clashing with the military.

filmography.title: The Private Files of J. Edgar Hoover
filmography.role_description: A portrayal of the controversial FBI director throughout his long career.
filmography.plot: A biographical drama that explores the life, career, and secrets of FBI Director J. Edgar Hoover.

filmography.title: Beau Geste
filmography.role_description: An American who joins the French Foreign Legion and befriends the Geste brothers.
filmography.plot: Three brothers join the Foreign Legion to escape a scandal and face a sadistic sergeant in the desert.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: The Time of Your Life
filmography.role_description: A bewildered policeman who questions the meaning of his job and life in a San Francisco bar.
filmography.plot: A diverse group of characters frequent a saloon, sharing their stories and philosophies on life.

filmography.title: Stop, You're Killing Me
filmography.role_description: A prohibition-era beer baron who tries to go legitimate after the repeal of the 18th Amendment.
filmography.plot: A former bootlegger tries to run a legitimate brewery but faces financial trouble and the bodies of four gangsters in his house.

filmography.title: Anna Lucasta
filmography.role_description: The brutish brother-in-law who dominates the Lucasta family.
filmography.plot: A family tries to marry off their daughter to a respectable man for money, despite her checkered past.

filmography.title: Lone Star
filmography.role_description: A wealthy Texas rancher and political leader who opposes the annexation of Texas.
filmography.plot: A cattle baron and a rancher clash over the future of Texas and the love of a newspaper woman.
